sentence.text: Bcl2-associated athanogene 3 (extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors) mutations have been reported to cause the myofibrillar myopathy (MFM) which shows progressive limb muscle weakness, respiratory failure, and cardiomyopathy.

entity.text: extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors

sentence.text: We aimed to cellular response to interleukin-4 the genetic cause of Korean patients with sensory motor polyneuropathy, myopathy and rigid spine.

We found extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors mutation in one patient with neuropathy, myopathy and rigid spine syndrome, and performed electrophysiological study, whole body MRI and muscle biopsy on the patient.

entity.text: extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors

sentence.text: She showed an axonal sensory-motor polyneuropathy like Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT), myopathy, rigid spine and respiratory dysfunction; however, she did not show any cardiomyopathy, which is a common symptom in extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors mutation.

entity.text: extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors

sentence.text: We described a extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway via death domain receptors mutation patient with atypical phenotype of CMT and myopathy, and those are expected to broaden the clinical spectrum of the disease and help to diagnose it
